alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 12:38PM PST until January 16 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...For portions of Roseburg in Douglas County. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 PM PST, the public reported rising water levels in Newton Creek through the city of Roseburg. This indicates the possibility of water accumulation in other areas with little or no drainage. The potential for small stream and urban flooding to begin or continue will persist through the evening with rainfall expected to continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roseburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
